intro: Pycnostachys batesii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with a rosette of broad, waxy leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or purple and bloom in spring and summer. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
